00047 void PgOptions::PgOpt::clearValue()
00048 {
00049   // free any malloced memory.
00050   if (m_valueMalloced!=NULL) {
00051     free(m_valueMalloced);
00052     m_valueMalloced=NULL;
00053   }
00054   m_value=NULL;
00055 }
00056 
00060 void PgOptions::PgOpt::resetToDefault() {
00061   clearValue();
00062   // no need to copy,
00063   setValue(m_defaultVal);
00064 }
00065 
00069 void PgOptions::PgOpt::setValueNoCopy(char const * const newValue) {
00070   clearValue();
00071   m_value=newValue;
00072 }
00073 
00079 void PgOptions::PgOpt::setValue(char const * const newValue) {
00080   clearValue();
00081   // no new value
00082   if (newValue==NULL) {
00083     m_value=NULL;
00084   }
00085   // no need to duplicate static data...
00086   else if (newValue==m_defaultVal) {
00087     // ... just copy the pointer.
00088     m_value=m_defaultVal;
00089   }
00090   // ...duplicate the new value.
00091   else {
00092     m_valueMalloced=strdup(newValue);
00093     assert(m_valueMalloced!=NULL);
00094     m_value=m_valueMalloced;
00095   }
00096 }

00104 PgOptions::PgOpt* PgOptions::findPgOpt(const std::string &longName) {
00105   map<string, PgOptions::PgOpt *>::iterator i = optionMap.find(longName);
00106   if(i == optionMap.end())
00107     return NULL;
00108   return i->second;
00109 }
00110 
00117 PgOptions::PgOpt* PgOptions::mustFindPgOpt(const std::string &name) {
00118   PgOpt *opt = findPgOpt(name);
00119   if(opt == NULL)
00120     Err::errAbort("Don't recognize option with name: '" +
00121             string(name) + "'.");
00122   return opt;
00123 }

00134 void PgOptions::printStringWidth(const char *str, int prefix,
00135                                  int currentPos, int maxWidth ) {
00136   Util::printStringWidth(cout, str, prefix, currentPos, maxWidth);
00137 }

00144 void PgOptions::usage(std::set<std::string> &hiddenOpts, bool printOpts) {
00145   PgOpt *opt = NULL;
00146   unsigned int maxLength = 0;
00147   unsigned int currentLength = 0;
00148   int i = 0;
00149   int extraChars = 6;
00150 
00151   cout << usageMsg.c_str();
00152   cout.put('\n');
00153   if(printOpts == true) {
00154     fprintf(stdout, "\noptions:\n");
00155     /* find the length of the longest option name. */
00156     for(i = 0; optSpec[i] != NULL; i++) {
00157       opt = optSpec[i];
00158       // check to see if we're hiding this option.
00159       if(hiddenOpts.find(opt->longName) != hiddenOpts.end())
00160         continue;
00161       // extraChars contains a padded space for options without a short flag,
00162       // subtract it off if there is a character.
00163       unsigned int length = strlen(opt->longName) + extraChars;
00164       if(maxLength < length)
00165         maxLength = length;
00166     }
00167     maxLength += 4; // three ' ' at the beginning and one ' ' at end.
00168     if(maxLength > 26)
00169       maxLength = 26;
00170 
00171     /* Loop through and print out the help. */
00172     for(i = 0; optSpec[i] != NULL; i++) {
00173       opt = optSpec[i];
00174       // check to see if we're hiding this option.
00175       if(hiddenOpts.find(opt->longName) != hiddenOpts.end())
00176         continue;
00177       if(strlen(opt->shortName) > 0)
00178         cout <<  "   -" << opt->shortName << ", --" << opt->longName << " ";
00179       /* Treat the longName as the shortName if the shortName is null. */
00180       else
00181         /* Line up just the long name if no short name. */
00182         cout <<  "       --" << opt->longName << " ";
00183       currentLength = strlen(opt->longName) + 10;
00184 
00185       while(currentLength < maxLength) {
00186         cout.put(' ');
00187         currentLength++;
00188       }
00189 
00190       printStringWidth(opt->help, maxLength, currentLength);
00191       cout.put('\n');
00192     }
00193   }
00194 }

00202 void PgOptions::addOnePgOpt(PgOpt *option) {
00203 
00204   string longName(option->longName);
00205   string shortName(option->shortName);
00206   optionMapIterator_t iter;
00207 
00208   if(option->getValue() != NULL) {
00209       Err::errAbort("Specify defaults as 'defaults', not initial values."
00210             "(see: '" + ToStr(option->longName) + "'='" +
00211             ToStr(option->getValue())+"')");
00212   }
00213 
00214   /* If option has been seen add to end of list. */
00215   iter = optionMap.find(longName);
00216   if(iter != optionMap.end()) {
00217     Err::errAbort("Option '" + longName + "' already defined.");
00218   }
00219   else { /* new option. */
00220     optionMap[longName] = option;
00221     /* ignore a null shortName */
00222     if (shortName != "")
00223       optionMap[shortName] = option;
00224   }
00225 }
00226 
00237 PgOptions::PgOptions(const std::string &usage, PgOpt *options[], bool allowDupes) {
00238   m_AllowDupes = allowDupes;
00239   usageMsg = usage;
00240   int optIx = 0;
00241   optSpec = options;
00242   for(optIx = 0; (options != NULL) && (options[optIx] != NULL); optIx++) {
00243     if(options[optIx]->getDefaultVal() == NULL) {
00244         Err::errAbort("Please specify default value for option '" +
00245               string(options[optIx]->longName) + "'");
00246     }
00247     checkOptType(options[optIx], options[optIx]->getDefaultVal());
00248     addOnePgOpt(options[optIx]);
00249   }
00250 }
00251 
00258 void PgOptions::checkOptType(PgOpt *opt, const char *value) {
00259   bool success = true;
00260 
00261   if(value == NULL) {
00262     Err::errAbort("expecting a value to be associated with option: '" + ToStr(opt->longName) + "'");
00263   }
00264   if(opt->type == INT_OPT) {
00265     Convert::toIntCheck(value, &success);
00266     if(!success) {
00267       Err::errAbort( "Argument for option: '" + string(opt->longName) +
00268                        " (" + string(opt->shortName) + ") is not an integer: " +
00269                        value);
00270     }
00271   }
00272   else if(opt->type == FLOAT_OPT) {
00273     Convert::toFloatCheck(value, &success);
00274     if(!success) {
00275       Err::errAbort( "Argument for option: '" + string(opt->longName) +
00276                        " (" + string(opt->shortName) + ") is not an float: " +
00277                        value);
00278     }
00279   }
00280 }
00281 
00291 void PgOptions::matchOption(const char *name, const char * const argv[], int *argIx) {
00292   PgOpt *opt = NULL;
00293   const char *s = name;
00294 
00295   while(s[0] == '-') // strip off any leading '-'s
00296     s++;
00297 
00298   opt = findPgOpt(string(s));
00299   if(opt == NULL)
00300     Err::errAbort("Don't recognize option: '" + string(name) + "'");
00301   /* Have we already seen this option? if so put it at the end of the list. */
00302   if(opt->getValue() != NULL) {
00303     if(!m_AllowDupes) {
00304       Err::errAbort("Option: " + ToStr(s) + " has already been specified with value: '" +
00305                     ToStr(opt->getValue()) + "'.");
00306     }
00307     PgOpt *p = new PgOpt, *tail = opt;
00308     /* Copy parent data. */
00309     p->shortName = opt->shortName;
00310     p->longName = opt->longName;
00311     p->type = opt->type;
00312     p->help = opt->help;
00313     p->m_defaultVal = opt->m_defaultVal;
00314     p->m_valueMalloced=NULL;
00315     p->setValue(NULL);
00316     p->next = NULL;
00317 
00318     /* Find last argument. */
00319     while(tail->next != NULL) {
00320       tail = tail->next;
00321     }
00322     tail->next = p;
00323     checkOptType(opt, argv[1]);
00324     //p->value = argv[1];
00325     p->setValue(argv[1]);
00326     (*argIx)++;
00327     m_ToFree.push_back(p);
00328   }
00329   else {
00330     if(opt->type == BOOL_OPT) {
00331       // bools are set to true when specified no more args needed.
00332       //opt->value = (const char *)"true";
00333       opt->setValue("true");
00334     }
00335     else { // Read in the next argument as being matched with option.
00336       checkOptType(opt, argv[1]);
00337       //opt->value = argv[1];
00338       opt->setValue(argv[1]);
00339       (*argIx)++;
00340     }
00341   }
00342 }
00343 
00349 void PgOptions::parseOptions(int argc, const char *const argv[]) {
00350   int argIx = 0;
00351 
00352   assert(argv);
00353   assert(optSpec);
00354   progName = string(argv[0]);
00355 
00356   // Loop through and match options with arguments.
00357   for(argIx = 1; argIx < argc; argIx++) {
00358     const char *s = argv[argIx];
00359     assert(s);
00360     if(s[0] == '-') {
00361       matchOption(s, argv+argIx, &argIx);
00362     }
00363     else {
00364       args.push_back(argv[argIx]);
00365     }
00366   }
00367 
00368   // Loop through options and set those that were not specified to default.
00369   for(argIx = 0; optSpec[argIx] != NULL; argIx++) {
00370     if (optSpec[argIx]->getValue() == NULL) {
00371       optSpec[argIx]->resetToDefault();
00372     }
00373   }
00374 }

00381 const char *PgOptions::strOpt(const char *name) {
00382   PgOpt *opt = mustFindPgOpt(name);
00383   return opt->getValue();
00384 }

00391 float PgOptions::floatOpt(const char *name) {
00392   PgOpt *opt = mustFindPgOpt(name);
00393   return Convert::toFloat(opt->getValue());
00394 }

00401 int PgOptions::intOpt(const char *name) {
00402   PgOpt *opt = mustFindPgOpt(name);
00403   return Convert::toInt(opt->getValue());
00404 }

00411 bool PgOptions::boolOpt(const char* name) {
00412   PgOpt *opt = mustFindPgOpt(name);
00413   return Convert::toBool(opt->getValue());
00414 }
00415 
00419 void PgOptions::resetToDefaults() {
00420   for(unsigned int i = 0; optSpec[i] != NULL; i++) {
00421     optSpec[i]->resetToDefault();
00422   }
00423 }
00424 
00425 void PgOptions::hack_resetOptionsList(PgOptions::PgOpt **optList)
00426 {
00427   while (*optList!=NULL) {
00428     (*optList)->m_value=NULL;
00429     (*optList)->m_valueMalloced=NULL;
00430     (*optList)->next=NULL;
00431     optList++;
00432   }
00433 }
